Fastapi Project documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

async fastapi_project.main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Database health check endpoint.

Verifies that the database is responsive and correctly configured.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – Dependency that provides an asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the database is not configured properly or not reachable.

Returns:

Message confirming the database is operational.

Return type:

dict

fastapi_project.main.index()¶

Root endpoint for the application.

Returns:

A welcome message.

Return type:

dict

fastapi_project.main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

Lifespan context for initializing and closing application-level resources.

This function sets up the Redis connection for FastAPI Limiter and closes it on shutdown.

Parameters:

app (FastAPI) – The FastAPI application instance.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Create a new contact associated with the given user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Schema with contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the new contact.

Returns:

The created Contact object.

Return type:

Contact

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Delete a contact by ID if it belongs to the user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The deleted Contact object or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, days: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve contacts whose birthdays fall within the given number of days from today.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip (for pagination).

  • days (int) – Range in days to look ahead for upcoming birthdays.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts should be checked.

Returns:

List of Contact objects with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve a single contact by ID, ensuring it belongs to the given user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The Contact object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Contact or None

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, use_get_filters: dict, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve a list of contacts filtered by parameters and scoped to the given user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip (for pagination).

  • use_get_filters (dict) – Dictionary of filters where keys are Contact model field names and values are expected values.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts should be retrieved.

Returns:

List of Contact objects matching the filters.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async fastapi_project.src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Update an existing contact owned by the user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactSchema) – Schema with updated contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The updated Contact object or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

REST API repository Users¶

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Set a user’s confirmed email flag to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user with optional Gravatar avatar.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – Schema with user registration data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

The newly created User object.

Return type:

User

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a user from the database by email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

User object if found, else None.

Return type:

User or None

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Update the avatar URL of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address of the user.

  • url (str or None) – New avatar URL or None.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

Updated User object.

Return type:

User

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update a user’s refresh token.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User object to update.

  • token (str or None) – New refresh token or None.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

async fastapi_project.src.repository.users.update_user_password(user: User, hash_password, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update a user’s password (already hashed).

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User object to update.

  • hash_password (str) – Hashed password string.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async SQLAlchemy session.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Contact data to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponseSchema

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

None

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact not found.

Returns:

Contact details.

Return type:

ContactResponseSchema

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts with optional filters.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return. Must be between 10 and 500.

  • offset (int) – Number of records to skip.

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – Filter contacts by first name.

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – Filter contacts by last name.

  • email (Optional[str]) – Filter contacts by email.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponseSchema]

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthday(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), days: int = Query(7), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve contacts with birthdays within a number of upcoming days.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – Number of records to skip.

  • days (int) – Number of upcoming days to check for birthdays.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[ContactResponseSchema]

async fastapi_project.src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Updated contact data.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact not found.

Returns:

Updated contact.

REST API routes Auth¶

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm a user’s email via token.

Parameters:

  • token – Email confirmation token.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate a user and generate JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body – Login credentials.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Raises:

HTTPException – If authentication fails or email is not confirmed.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access and refresh tokens using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – Bearer token credentials.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Send a confirmation email if the email is not confirmed yet.

Parameters:

  • body – Email input.

  • background_tasks – Background task manager.

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Status message.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.request_reset_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Send a password reset email.

Parameters:

  • body – Email input.

  • background_tasks – Background task manager.

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Status message.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.reset_password(request: Request, token: str, new_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), confirm_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Process the password reset.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • token – Password reset token.

  • new_password – New password.

  • confirm_password – Password confirmation.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Success or error message.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.reset_password_form(request: Request, token: str)¶

Render the HTML form for password reset.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • token – Password reset token.

Returns:

HTML form template.

async fastapi_project.src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user account.

Parameters:

  • body – User registration data.

  • bt – Background task manager.

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

Created user details.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email already exists.

REST API routes Users¶

async fastapi_project.src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

user (User) – The current authenticated user, resolved from the access token.

Returns:

The authenticated user’s details.

Return type:

UserResponse

async fastapi_project.src.routes.users.update_user_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Upload and update the avatar for the current user.

The image is uploaded to Cloudinary and a resized (250x250) image URL is stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded avatar image file.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API service Auth¶

class fastapi_project.src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

A class responsible for handling authentication, token generation, and user retrieval.

ALGORITHM = 'HS512'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'someverysecretkey'¶
cache = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(host=localhost,port=1111,db=0)>)>)>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generate a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional time in seconds until token expires.

Returns:

Encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create a token for email confirmation.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

Returns:

Encoded JWT token for email verification.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generate a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional time in seconds until token expires.

Returns:

Encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode and validate a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The JWT refresh token.

Returns:

The email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid or scope is incorrect.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve the current user based on the access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – JWT token from request header.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

The authenticated user object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid or user not found.

async static get_email_from_request(request: Request)¶

Extract email address from Authorization header in the request.

Parameters:

request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token in the Authorization header.

Return type:

str

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Extract email address from a token.

Parameters:

token (str) – JWT token.

Returns:

The email address encoded in the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid or cannot be decoded.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hash a plaintext password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Plain password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify a plain password against its hashed version.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async fastapi_project.src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a confirmation email to the user.

This function sends an email with a verification token and a confirmation link to the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – Username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – Base URL or domain to be used in the confirmation link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If sending the email fails due to a connection issue.

async fastapi_project.src.services.email.send_rp_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a password reset email to the user.

This function sends an email containing a reset token and a link to reset the password.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – Username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – Base URL or domain to be used in the reset link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If sending the email fails due to a connection issue.
